Former American diplomat Robert Malley: 'Trump's Gaza plan offers more ambiguities and potential pitfalls than clear answers'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Robert Malley, who participated in peace negotiations between Israel and Palestine under Bill Clinton, Barack Obama and Joe Biden, sees Donald Trump's plan as yet another attempt that fails to take history into account. In particular, he questions the relevance of the two-state solution.

title: In Morocco, 'The regime made a mistake in thinking that by offering the people sporting events, they would forget their problems'
subhead: As Morocco's Gen Z takes to the streets, King Mohammed VI no longer has a political force capable of offering an 'alternative solution,' says researcher Thierry Desrues in an interview with Le Monde.

title: The disconcerting world of Pump.fun
subhead: The cryptocurrency creation and trading platform, which now sees itself as a social hub rivaling TikTok and Twitch, has reactivated its live video features. Unsurprisingly, horrific and disturbing scenes have once again appeared on the site.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'If Europe does not urgently give up its love of free trade, it risks an unprecedented social and industrial disaster'
subhead: Europe should impose tariffs as a sort of tax on the CO₂ generated by the transportation of goods and to counter the damaging effects of Chinese dumping, writes the French economist.

title: Trump's tariff war persists, destabilizing global trade
subhead: Six months ago, on April 2, the president of the United States unveiled his 'reciprocal tariffs' on the rest of the world. Since then, Washington has wielded the threat of new taxes to pressure its partners.

title: Manchester synagogue attack leaves British Jewish community in shock
subhead: Two people were killed and four injured in an attack at Heaton Park synagogue in Manchester on Thursday, during Yom Kippur celebrations. The assailant, shot dead by police, was called a terrorist by authorities.
